Pre-Game Insights: Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) announced that singers Arijit Singh, Shankar Mahadevan, and Sukhwinder Singh will perform during a pre-match show at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on October 14.
Ace Photographer Atul Kasbekar criticized the BCCI for not having an opening ceremony for the first game of the tournament but organizing a song and dance performance for the India vs Pakistan match.

Ahead of the match, Ahmedabad police have issued a notification designating the city a 'no-drone zone' during the India-Pakistan ICC World Cup Cricket Match at Narendra Modi Stadium on October 14, 2023.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The rivalry between India and Pakistan in cricket is one of the most fierce in the world, with matches between the two countries receiving significant global viewership.
Indian Railways will run two special trains on the day from Mumbai to Ahmedabad to clear an 'extra rush of cricket fans.'

Restaurants are trying to come up with unique offerings to draw fans, such as Tijuana, a Mexican restaurant in Mumbai, which has a package that includes cricket-themed trivia rounds and a special menu using elements of Indian and Pakistani cuisine.
